FuncDef: The display ipv6 nd rate-limit interface command displays the ND packet rate limit of an interface.
CLIs: display ipv6 nd { na | ns-multicast | ns-unicast } rate-limit interface { <interface-type> <interface-num> | <interface-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of a specified interface.
-

Specifies the number of a specified interface.
-

Specifies the name of a specified interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display ipv6 nd na rate-limit interface gigabitethernet 1/0/1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check the ND packet rate limit information on an interface, including the ND (NA, NS multicast, and NS unicast) packet rate limit and interface information, run the display ipv6 nd rate-limit interface command.
Precautions
This command is not applicable to Layer 2 Ethernet interfaces, flexible access interfaces, QinQ stacking interfaces, or QinQ mapping interfaces, or EVC sub-interfaces.
